Name: Scarab
Description: Small objects were deposited at the temple of Hathor as votive offerings by Egyptians during expeditions to Sinai. Items from Petrie's excavations now in Dublin include, exceptionally, a series of small scarabs. This example has a detailed back with rounded head-ends, v-marks at the shoulders, and dividing-lines around the wing-cases. The undersides bears in crudely incised hieroglyphs the royal title 'the Good God' and Menkheperra, the throne-name of Tuthmosis III, used as a talisman during his reign and for centuries after.
